title: I Come to the Garden Alone

author.name: C. Austin Miles
author.bio: C. Austin Miles was an American gospel music composer, best known for his hymn 'In the Garden,' written in 1912. He was originally trained as a pharmacist but turned to gospel music, writing many hymns and serving as an editor and manager for hymnals.

lyrics:
1 I come to the garden alone,
While the dew is still on the roses;
And the voice I hear, falling on my ear,
The Son of God discloses.

Chorus:
And He walks with me
And he talks with me,
And he tells me
I am his own
And the joy we share
As we tarry there
None other has ever known

2 He speaks
And the sound
Of his voice
Is so sweet
The birds
Hush their singing
And melody
That He gave to me
Within my Heart
Is ringing

3 I'd stay in the
Garden with Him
Thro' the night
Around me be falling;
But He bids me go
Thru' the voice of woe,
His Voice to me is calling
